Manual Mode requires you to manually register a sajda. On the next page, you will see a blue box. Simply tap anywhere inside the blue box with your finger to register the sajda.

The light sensor mode automatically detects your sajda gesture. It uses changes in light intensity to recognize the gesture. To use this mode effectively, place the phone beneath you as you bend forward for the sajda, ensuring that the phone is hidden by your shadow. Please note that this mode may have some limitations, especially if the light comes from all directions or if the room is either too bright or too dim.

The proximity sensor mode automatically detects your sajda gesture. It uses the distance between you and your phone to recognize the gesture. Please note that in most devices, the proximity sensor detects objects within a range of approximately 5 cm from the phone. To use this mode effectively, place the phone beneath you as you bend forward for the sajda, ensuring that your nose is almost touching the screen. Being in close proximity to the phone is necessary for it to work properly.
